intro: Verticordia serrata var. ciliata, commonly known as the serrated featherflower, is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae and is native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences composed of numerous small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. It produces small, linear leaves that are often hairy along the edges, contributing to its common name. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
